docs.title: AI Engineer | Senior Hands-On Architect
docs.text:
I have completed formal education in Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning from The University of Texas at Austin and am currently focused on learning, experimenting, and building AI systems to deepen my practical understanding.

This site serves as a technical workspace where I explore modern AI patterns, document design decisions, and build real systems—ranging from RAG-based applications and Agentic AI workflows to backend APIs that support LLM-driven use cases.

The emphasis here is on hands-on learning, system thinking, and sharing insights with the broader AI and open-source community.

docs.title: Purpose of This Site
docs.text:
It exists to:

  • Apply AI/ML concepts through real implementations
  • Explore strengths and limitations of LLM-based systems
  • Document architectural trade-offs and engineering decisions
  • Share experiments and learnings openly

I treat AI systems the same way I treat distributed systems: they must be understood, observable, and explainable.

docs.title: 🔹 Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG)
docs.text:
• Knowledge-driven AI over documents, APIs, and structured data
  • Experimentation with chunking strategies and embedding models
  • Techniques for grounding responses and reducing hallucinations

docs.title: 🔹 Agentic AI
docs.text:
• Tool-using agents with planning, memory, and control flow
  • Single-agent and multi-agent experiments
  • Applying agents to real analytical and automation tasks

docs.title: 🔹 Backend APIs for AI Systems
docs.text:
• Cloud-native APIs that expose and orchestrate LLM capabilities
  • Event-driven and asynchronous service patterns
  • Designing AI systems with reliability and observability in mind

docs.title: How I Work
docs.text:
My approach is iterative and systems-oriented:

  • Start with fundamentals and theory
  • Build focused experiments and prototypes
  • Evolve promising ideas into structured systems
  • Measure behavior, performance, and cost
  • Document findings and lessons learned

This approach helps bridge formal education with practical engineering insight.

docs.title: Background
docs.text:
• Principal Software Engineer – Dell Technologies Extensive experience building and supporting cloud-native, enterprise-scale systems.

  • AI & ML Education Post Graduate Program in Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning The University of Texas at Austin

  • Engineering Focus Cloud-native architecture, microservices, event-driven systems, reliability, and observability.

This background strongly influences how I approach AI—as a system, not just a model.

docs.title: What You’ll Find Here
docs.text:
Projects and experiments documented on this site include:

  • RAG applications over real-world data
  • Embedding-based semantic search systems
  • Agentic AI workflows with tool execution
  • Backend services designed for AI use cases

Each project captures:

  • The problem being explored
  • Design and implementation choices
  • Observed behavior and limitations
  • Learnings and future directions

docs.title: 👉 View Projects
docs.text: Browse experiments, system designs, and applied AI use cases I’m actively working on and refining.

docs.title: Connect
docs.text:
• GitHub – Source code, notebooks, and experiments
  • Hugging Face – Live demos, models, and collections
  • LinkedIn – Professional background and ongoing work

This site reflects continuous learning and experimentation, not a fixed destination.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: Describe the problem and business use case.

docs.title: Tech Stack
docs.text:
• Python
  • Hugging Face
  • LangChain
  • FAISS

docs.title: Approach
docs.text:
• Chunking strategy
  • Embedding model
  • Retrieval flow
  • Prompt engineering

docs.title: Evaluation
docs.text:
• Accuracy
  • Latency
  • Cost considerations

docs.title: Demo
docs.text: 👉 Hugging Face Space 👉 GitHub Repository

docs.title: Learnings
docs.text: Key tradeoffs and future improvements.

docs.title: TEKS Math AI Tutor – Grade 5
docs.text:
A Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) based AI tutoring system built exclusively for Grade 5 Mathematics, aligned with the Texas Essential Knowledge and Skills (TEKS) curriculum.

📘 Curriculum Reference: https://tea.texas.gov/academics/curriculum-standards/teks/grade5-teks-062024-0.pdf

This project uses curriculum-grounded retrieval to ensure accurate, grade-appropriate, and explainable math responses for students, parents, and teachers.

docs.title: 📖 Project Description
docs.text: The TEKS Math AI Tutor is designed to answer Grade 5 mathematics questions using only official TEKS curriculum content.

docs.title: Key Capabilities
docs.text:
• Retrieves relevant TEKS standards from a vector database
  • Uses a Large Language Model (LLM) with retrieved context
  • Produces responses in a strict JSON schema
  • Prevents hallucinations by disallowing non-curriculum knowledge

docs.title: 🔹 High-Level Flow
docs.text:
1. TEKS Grade 5 Math document ingestion
  2. Text cleaning and chunking
  3. Embedding generation
  4. Vector database creation
  5. Query-time retrieval (Top-K relevant chunks)
  6. Prompt + retrieved context sent to LLM
  7. Structured JSON response returned

docs.title: 1️⃣ Loading Documents into Vector Database
docs.text: Documents → Chunking → Embeddings → Vector DB

docs.title: 2️⃣ User Interface → API → LLM
docs.text: User Query → Retriever → Prompt + Context → LLM → JSON Response

docs.title: 📚 Knowledge Base
docs.text:
• Texas Essential Knowledge and Skills (TEKS) – Grade 5 Mathematics
  • Curriculum text is chunked and embedded
  • Each response references a relevant TEKS standard

docs.title: Scope Restriction
docs.text:
• Grade 5 Math only
  • No external knowledge

docs.title: 📓 Jupyter Notebook Workflow
docs.text:
The includes:

  • TEKS document loading
  • Text preprocessing and chunking
  • Embedding creation
  • Vector store initialization
  • Prompt engineering
  • RAG-based question answering tests

The notebook was used to validate the pipeline before Hugging Face deployment.

docs.title: User Question
docs.text: Prepare 15 problems on the topic Geometry and Measurement

docs.title: Model Response (Example)
docs.text:
{
  "type": "Questions",
  "message": [
    {
      "Question": "What is the shape with four equal sides and four right angles?",
      "Answers": {
        "A": "Rectangle",
        "B": "Square",
        "C": "Triangle",
        "D": "Circle"
      },
      "CorrectOption": "B",
      "CorrectAnswer": "Square"
    }
  ]
}

docs.title: 📄 Response Schema
docs.text:
{
    "type": "object",
    "additionalProperties": False,
    "required": ["type", "message"],
    "properties": {
      "type": {"type": "string", "enum": ["Concept", "Questions", "Refusal"]},
      "message": {
        "anyOf": [
          {"type": "string"},
          {
            "type": "array",
            "maxItems": 5, 
            "items": {
              "type": "object",
              "additionalProperties": False,
              "required": ["Question", "Answers", "CorrectOption", "CorrectAnswer"],
              "properties": {
                "Question": {"type": "string"},
                "Answers": {
                  "type": "object",
                  "additionalProperties": False,
                  "required": ["A", "B", "C", "D"],
                  "properties": {
                    "A": { "type": "string" },
                    "B": { "type": "string" },
                    "C": { "type": "string" },
                    "D": { "type": "string" }
                  }
                },
                "CorrectOption": {"type": "string", "enum": ["A", "B", "C", "D"]},
                "CorrectAnswer": {"type": "string"}
              }
            }
          }
        ]
      }
    }
  }

docs.title: ACCURACY / ANTI-HALLUCINATION RULES:
docs.text:
Do the math carefully. Ensure only one correct option unless the user explicitly asks for multiple correct answers. If you detect ambiguity (missing numbers/units), ask ONE clarifying question using: {"type":"Concept","message":"I need one detail to answer: ..."} (Keep it math-only and kid-safe.)

STYLE GUIDELINES: - Use simple words and short sentences for kids. - For parents/teachers, add a brief note on how to support learning (1–2 sentences). - Avoid unrelated topics, brand names, or personal data requests.

docs.title: ☁️ Hugging Face Deployment
docs.text:
Backend is deployed on Hugging Face Spaces:

https://huggingface.co/spaces/TokenTutor/Grade5MathBackend

docs.title: ⚙️ Local Setup
docs.text:
git clone https://github.com/TechTrojan/TEKS-Math-AI-Tutor.git
cd TEKS-Math-AI-Tutor
pip install -r requirements.txt
export OPENAI_API_KEY="your_api_key"

Vector DB creation steps are provided in the Jupyter Notebook.

docs.title: 🎯 Use Cases
docs.text:
• Grade 5 student tutoring
  • Teacher lesson planning
  • Curriculum-aligned AI demos
  • Educational RAG reference

docs.title: 🚀 Future Scope & Enhancements
docs.text: This project is designed with extensibility in mind. The following enhancements outline the planned roadmap to evolve the TEKS Math AI Tutor into a scalable, multi-grade educational platform.

docs.title: 🔮 Functional Enhancements
docs.text:
• User Authentication & Activity Tracking Introduce secure user authentication (e.g., OAuth or token-based login) to identify users uniquely and maintain session-level context. This will enable:
  • User-specific interaction history
  • Learning progress tracking

  • Personalized tutoring experiences

  • Multi-Grade & Multi-Subject Expansion Extend the current Grade 5 Math–only scope to support:

  • Additional grades (Grades 1–12)

  • Multiple subjects (Science, English, Social Studies, etc.) Each grade and subject will have isolated curriculum ingestion and retrieval pipelines to preserve accuracy.

  • Enhanced User Interface (UI/UX) Develop a richer and more interactive frontend with:

  • Chat-based tutoring interface
  • Visual explanations (charts, diagrams)

  • Improved accessibility and mobile responsiveness

  • User Subscription & Interest-Based Notifications Implement a subscription module allowing users to:

  • Select preferred grades and subjects
  • Subscribe to specific topics or skill areas

The system will periodically generate and send relevant practice questions, quizzes, or learning tips to users via email based on their preferences.

docs.title: 🔹 Retrieval Quality Dependence  Add structured logging across the system, including:
docs.text:
• The quality of generated answers is highly dependent on the retriever.
  • If relevant curriculum chunks are not retrieved (due to embedding similarity errors or suboptimal chunking), the LLM may produce:
  • Incomplete explanations
  • Overly generic responses
  • There is no secondary validation or reranking mechanism in place.

docs.title: 🔹 Limited Context Window
docs.text:
• Only a fixed number of top-K retrieved chunks are passed to the LLM.
  • Important curriculum details may be omitted if they fall outside the retrieved context.
  • This can impact answers for:
  • Multi-step problems
  • Broad or cross-topic questions

docs.title: 🔹 Limited Personalization
docs.text:
• The current architecture does not maintain:
  • User memory
  • Learning history
  • Skill progression
  • All users receive the same responses for identical queries, regardless of prior interactions.

docs.title: 🔹 No Answer Verification Layer
docs.text:
• Generated responses are not validated against:
  • Rule-based checks
  • Mathematical solvers
  • Ground-truth answer keys
  • Although curriculum grounding reduces hallucinations, absolute correctness is not guaranteed.
  • Scalable Knowledge Management in Vector Database Enhance the vector database design to:
  • Store embeddings segmented by grade, subject, and curriculum
  • Dynamically load and query the appropriate knowledge base at runtime
  • Support efficient scaling as new curricula are added

This modular approach will enable seamless expansion without impacting existing grade-level accuracy.

These enhancements aim to transform the project from a single-grade RAG demo into a full-scale, curriculum-aware AI tutoring platform suitable for real-world educational deployment.

docs.title: ⚠️ Disclaimer
docs.text:
This project is designed and developed solely for learning, research, and experimental purposes.

  • The implementation is intended to demonstrate concepts such as Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG), curriculum grounding, and AI-based tutoring.
  • It is not intended for commercial use, production deployment, or monetization.
  • The authors make no guarantees regarding accuracy, completeness, or fitness for any commercial or real-world educational deployment.
  • Any use of this project beyond educational or experimental contexts is at the user’s own risk.

All curriculum content referenced remains the property of their respective owners, and this project is not affiliated with or endorsed by the Texas Education Agency (TEA).

docs.title: Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) Systems
docs.text:
This section groups my work on Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG)— with an emphasis on grounded, constrained, and explainable AI systems.

Rather than treating RAG as a single pattern, I explore it as a design space involving trade-offs across retrieval quality, chunking strategy, embedding selection, and context management.

docs.title: Focus Areas
docs.text:
• Curriculum- and domain-grounded retrieval
  • Anti-hallucination techniques
  • Schema-enforced responses
  • Vector database design
  • Prompt and retrieval orchestration

docs.title: 📘 TEKS Math AI Tutor – Grade 5
docs.text:
Curriculum-grounded RAG system aligned with official TEKS standards

  • Scope-restricted knowledge base
  • Strict JSON response schema
  • Designed to prevent non-curriculum hallucinations

👉 View Project

Future RAG projects will continue to build on these patterns and learnings.
